text: Excavation support drawings reviewed and stamped by professional engineer
Geotechnical recommendations on soil conditions and allowable excavation methods confirmed
Engineered shoring system or benching/sloping method selected based on soil type
Trench box/sheet pile installed prior to personnel entry
Shoring systems installed per stamped plan and aligned with excavation profile
Bracing, wales, or hydraulic components installed securely and inspected for defects
Spoil piles placed minimum 1 m (3 ft) from trench edge
Daily pre-entry trench inspections completed and documented by competent person
Inspections conducted after rain, vibration, or any soil movement
Warning signage and restricted zone markings clearly in place
Ladders or safe access provided for all trench depths >1.2 m (4 ft)
Backfill completed in lifts, with progressive removal of shoring equipment
No trench collapse, soil cave-ins, or structural issues during removal
Final inspection completed and documented prior to full demobilization

id: • OH&S Code – Alberta (Part 32), OSHA 1926 Subpart P, CSA S269.1
• Geotechnical Report, Stamped Shoring Plans, Trench Manufacturer Guidelines
